Posts.Title: Christmas presents did you really think this out

Posts.Content: Hiya Pat Hope you managed to get up for work ok . You made me laugh when reading all of your posts from last night , busy bee. Re little Missy, I bought some if those training pads for dogs. I actually thought they were pads / nappies and was ready to put them on my two girlies ! Most disappointed when they were just squares of absorbent stuff that you encourage the dogs to use. Good old fashioned newspaper does the same. Your little one will find a "favourite " place, put the pads there, let her use it, then move it , not the same one , that would next bit smelly, in stages towards the back door , or wherever she is meant to do her business. That's the theory !!!! With 2 Springer Spaniels , it took about 2 months to be totally poo free!!! I am no Barbara Woodhouse, nearly put Barbara Cartland !!!, but hope that helps Don't overdo it at work. Enjoy . Xxxxx. Sue xxxxX
Posts.Title: Christmas presents did you really think this out

Posts.Content: Hi JP Will try to Pm you when I can work out how to do it....this site is confusing me at the moment....does not take a lot !!! You rationale sounds so similar to mine. I have always had problems with BOTH boobs. Lumpy/sore, fibro adenomas etc etc. 6 months before my diagnosis I had been to the GP telling him I could feel lumps in both boobs. Virtualy told not to be silly...just scar tissue from previous removals (x6). Fast forward 6 mths and two of the lumps I felt turned out to be Invasive Ductal Carcinoma. So.............I make no apologies for being paranoid....and just want it to be one less thing for me to worry about. I am not going to do anything now....waiting until I see the surgeon again in March, when I will have my first annual mamogram. This is when we would be discussing reconstruction. Just getting my ammo ready. Thanks for your help. xx Sue

Posts.Title: Proposed chemo regime - looking for advice, info, help please

Posts.Content: Hi Keira I hate injections and dreaded doing them but I heard on here how some ladies did not get them, post code lottery I think, and the benefits , less chance of infection and thereby possible stays in hospital ..... And somehow it became something I wanted. They offered me the district nurse, every day for the 5 days they were needed them, but I did not want to have to hang around waiting for her to come , so managed them myself. They really are easy to do, I worked out how to do it without looking !!!! Honest it was that easy . They can show someone else in your family how to do it , I know some otherhalves have done the deed for them. Whoever does it....... It is worth it. I did not get any high temperatures, major infections and stayed out if hospital , other than scheduled appointments. Tell you what. This bootcamp certainly works .... No one would have believed me before all this crap , if I told them what I would put up with!!! But ...... We don't have much choice ... Do we !!! That's not a question . XxxxxX. Sue

Posts.Title: Anyone on Zoledronic Acid or Capecitabine

Posts.Content: Hi. Day 5 for about 5 days is the time white blood cell count goes down and your immune system hits its lowest . So feeling shattered is "normal" . Just be careful , if you feel unwell take your temperature, you need to make sure you don't get an infection. Don't panic if you do though, all can be sorted with antibiotics. Just dont leave it . Some hospitals give you injections to do at home to increase the white blood cells for those days, mine did.and I did not have any infection and I did not get overly tired, well no more than usual whilst on chemo. Take care, lots of rest and TLC. Xx Sue xX

Posts.Title: What to drink?

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha You are not a wimp and it is not trivial. I have not had or at the moment do not plan to have radiotherapy but I would have found that totally unacceptable. These people are so used to their "job" they seem to forget that the people they deal with have feelings. Posts.Title: Is RADS always like this?

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha Originally it was surgery and radiotherapy...then as I had a micro amount in my sentinel lymph node it all changed. Surgery and chemo. Because there were clear margins from the surgery radiotherapy not necessary. I was offered to take part in a trial wherby I do have radiotherapy every day for three weeks but weighing in up....if they were happy with the margins...why should I ??? I know I should feel like I should help research but at the moment I just want an end to "treatment", with the exception of Herceptin and Arinidex.... Still not 100% sure.....but 99.9% I will say no. Seeing Oncologist tomorrow. xxxx Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: Is RADS always like this?

I used to talk about things other than poo issues, painkillers,boob jobs of the MX type etc....honest. Hope "things improve for you soon.   xxSuexx

Posts.Title: Moral support

Posts.Content: Hi Sassy Good to hear your update and you are being your usual kick ass self. It is so aggravating to have to wait but I suppose it is best they chose the most effective solution for you rather than rushing it and then everyone doubting if it was the right choice. Even you must give yourself times to want to to scream , cry and generally feel miserable ...... And then you can pick yourself up , dust yourself down and carry on the fight. I know I need days when I want to be alone so I can give in to being scared/frightened or whatever , without upsetting everyone around me. I have had house guests for 6 weeks solid and whilst I am sure I will miss them, at the moment I am enjoying my own peace ( well as much peace as i can I get with two springer spaniels and 2 cats!) So...... Give yourself permission to be a miserable bugger for x amount of time, then do something you know will lift your spirits, alcoholic or not. Sometimes you need the lows to reach hight highs .... If that makes sense . You are a bouncy type and whatever they chuck at you ..... You will deal with it... We can help you for a change. So best wishes to our one breasted warrior queen. Big hugs :0))
Posts.Title: Post-surgery results and treatment plan ...

Posts.Content: Hi Think Chemo brain has struck...thought you were just going on FEC. Re Tax.....just get stocked up on...Painkillers, something other than parcetemol/ibuprofen....just in case, I had Tramadol which definately needed on T1, not so much on Tax2 and the jury is out on Tax 3 (today). The achy legs, hips, and feet were the worse. I then had a sore mouth/throat. Which I left too long before getting help. Once i ahd the meds it got better within a few days.. So 10 days ish of not so good...but then I was and have been fine. Tax 2 not so bad, just getting more tired, which is more to do with the cumulative effect of chemo....seems like lots of people get chemo 5 meltdown... Don't worry about it in advance....it may not be as bad for you....just be prepared and don't hang around if you feel unwell...see your GP they have things for most of the side effects. At least you don't get that sicky feeling on Tax, Make sure you have something for constipation, I have Laxidol. which is quite gentle, think it is the painkillers that bunge you up...Joy of joys !!! Whatever happens remember all this crap is temporary...even the hair loss, and you are kicking the unwanted invader out of your system. It is worth it..... i can say that truthfully now I have finished the bloody chemo....yippppeee. xx Sue xx

Posts.Title: Hi everyone

Posts.Content: Funny how we all think think about this question at some time....but that in itself is good. To me it means we are thinking that we have NOT got "it". If not there would not be a question. Does that sound like chemo thinking ???  Our surgeons no doubt have said the same to all of us, they are happy they have got it all ....or else we would have been back for a second clearance.  Our Oncologist no doubt have all said something very similar, chemo/rads are the insurance policy, mop up any possible stray cancer cells wherever they may be. For those of us lucky enough to be on Herceptin/Tamoxifen/Arimidex, or whatever the cocktail of the day is ......thats just to try to make sure the little blighter does not come back. So....HAD ...it is for me. For those into self help books/techniques....again the theory is you can help yourself fight against cancer by believing the cancer is gone, boosting your immune system etc etc etc.    So...unless I am in a dark mood....and that happens only sometimes...less now than before.. I HAVE HAD CANCER...... but still having preventative treatment...thats not sitting on the fence....is it ??
Posts.Title: HAD or HAVE?

Posts.Content: Hi Physically.....much better than I thought. Not so painful as I expected. In and out of hospital within 2 days ! Mentally....initially just so glad that the bl**dy cancer had been removed I accepted that not having my boob was worth it. It does hit you sometime later that you really dont want to look the way you do. But even though I still dont like the way I look I don't regret my MX. Reconstruction may be the answer for some....acceptance for others. Either way........we all do whatever it takes to survive don't we. Take care......drink lots before and after your op . Others on here will give you lots of sound advice as to what to take with you, how to distract yourself .But from me........I just wish you well.

Posts.Title: Can you have to much water?

Posts.Content: Hi Sassy Hope FEC is being kinder to you now. It is soooo important to flush all the crap out, hard to do when you feel so sick though. Just keep trying different things to tempt you... Lemonade, once the fizz had subsided worked well, as did ginger beer. Ribena and Vimto with lots of ice, gingrs crossed for you. How many FEC are you having ? For me , once I changed one if the anti sickness drugs the side effects were do able. It was realitively quick, I usually felt ok during the day of chemo, then on the first one just felt nauseous . That lasted 2-3 days and then I was ok (ish), just got tired quickly, but recovered well if I rested. I found the anti sickness one they changed made me feel, spaced out. I have never driven with both hands on the wheel,slower than the speed limit .. but was having to do that and concentrate on the road, sitting forward, driving like Mr Magoo ( if you know who he is ... !!!!!) FEC 2 & 3 , I was actually sick on the night of chemo but felt much better once I had been ill. This from someone who has a panic attack , literally, if I am ill. I was then ok after, just the tiredness. ! Obviously lost my hair but after the initial shock that was ok. Doxcetacel 1 affected me worse. Probably going jn to the unknown we part of it and it lulled me into a false sense of security, crafty do and so. Days 1-4 I felt fine... Day 5 and I have not felt so much pain in so many joints .. All at the same time. From my hips down anything that moved hurt. I am not a wimp but Parecetemol and ibuprofen did nog touch it. I got Tramadol from the Dr but it took 2-3 days for the pain to become a dull ache. Then I got a mouth a throat infection. Could not eat and even drinking was painful. Once I got meds from the Dr it took nearly a week to clear up. So about 10 days of misery . Stocked up on all drugs ready for round 2 as I was going on a canal boat trip , booked before all of this horror story called BC,. The good news is number 2 had been much better . Just achy, not pain ... Mouth a bit sore but not infected . Taste buds definitely out of sorts..... Can' t believe I cannot eat chocolate, what is the world coming to !! So the usual pineapple, melon , sorbets , have been all I have wanted I've the past 10 days. A bit awkward when the " fun" bit of the canal boat trip was stopping off here and there for lunch/dinner ..... Everyone else stuffing their faces and me trying to be sociable , trying to find something soft, not creamy, can't do creamy things at the moment, and failing miserably which made me more and more miserable over the past week. Only just starting to feel like me.... Now I am back home. I have been very tired, but that could be the Tramadol, which I have taken mainly at night, to make sure I could sleep. I am definitely getting more "emotional "and we won't go into relationship with the OH..... I hate the way I look at the moment , my eye lashes and brows are almost none existant , so I now officially look ill and can't stand looking at myself. Short term I know but horrible . Still can't change if so ... Let's just get over it . But the best news is ONLY 1 more to go , roll on 4th September. Think I may have been a big daft booking a trip to Spain leaving on 7th September !!!! But have a villa with it's own pool, so I can be lopsided as much as I like , get up when I like , eat when/ if / what I want . I am near a friend who lives out there so won' t be isolated. Have you made any plans for holidays, rewarding yourself for putting up with this like of poo left on our doorsteps? Thanks for keeping in touch , I always look out for you posting and was wondering how you were managing . Have you heard from Dorothee ? Not seen any posts from her recently. Good luck. XxxX. Sue Hope the typing is ok, can't go back to change things .

Posts.Content: Hi Jac I am sure others will come along and say the sane as me ......probably better than I can.... But how you are feeling is so "normal" . You have been through a lot. Your poor body has taken a pounding, no wonder you are right down there in the dumps . It would be more deputising if you did not have a wobble . The best I can say us it will pass. Posts.Title: First Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi Annie. I started to reply to you ages ago .... On sentenced my battery went !!!!! Well notice actually ... My iPhone. And lo and behold .... I get all charged up and ..... Everyone has said exactly what I was going to say. TAX is sooooooo bad ... It's good. Most if us have felt that " I can't do this anymore" feeling. I had it after the first and second session and only did the last because it was that ..... The last TAX. That was something to celebrate.... If only I had the energy !!!! We all do it in the end because we want the best chance of getting the better of this bloody awful disease. I am now in recovery phase still 3 months since chemo finished and proof that life dies somehow start to get back to some dirt of "normal" albeit a different one. As for any further treatments ..... I don't think anything can be as bad as TAX. My brother is being treated for Bone Marrow cancer and he has chemo in tablet form .... so don't fear something that might not happen. You have enough to deal with getting on with now..... And you'd next TAX . Do however talk to the chemo people.... Tell them how you are feeling physically and mentally , they are good .... But not psychic ..... They need to know.... Abc be assured they won't let you have it jobless you are fit enough . So ........ Pull on that rope..... Feel us all pushing you ... Lifting you upwards and onwards .... Neatly there....Ind more step. Xxxxxxxxxxx. :0)). Xxxxxxxxxxx

Posts.Title: Herceptin AND Tamoxifen at the same time?

Posts.Content: Curly kayle. Broccoli, cauliflower etc dell meant up be good too, organic if poss. Had chilli con Carnegie tonight Roth brussels !!! Low fat, and minimum alcohol . Well I stick to dome of this.. Most of the time ! Have also been having flax seed in my cereal.... Good for poos and lower osteogen. Manuka honey good for warding off infection. As said before pineapple yo help Ruth getting your taste buds going during chemo, melon titled for me too . Basically just try to eat healthily . Avoid pâté, seafood,unpastutrised cheese etc, a lot of this is covered in the Macmillan and breast care booklet they should have given you . If not this web site covers it . Good luck. Xxxx
Posts.Title: Hi I'm new here...

Posts.Content: Hi Annie First thing is.....you did it....you faced your fear and got through the horrid scan.....so that in itself is something to be proud of. Don't underestimate the things you do manage to get through on this rocky road .......the fact someone should have forewarned ypu probably just saved you a few sleepless nights !!! not that it makes it right but....every cloud.............. etc etc etc Second....... You have seen all the posts on here about the side effects we have had on TAX.....the biggest one for me being the totally wiped out feeling. This was a cumulative effect. It helped me understand why I was feeling like poo when I saw the blood test results from start of treatment to chemo number 5. The deterioration showed in figures,month by month, which seemed to help the penny drop, that this thing that is meant to save me.......is /was doing what it should do....kill off cells....good and bad. So feeling bad suddenly felt better !!! I hope that sort of makes sense.   You must do what i have seen you say to others......accept that feeling the way you do is "normal", allow yourself to be miserable about it.....but set yourself some kind of time limit.....so you can tell yourself it is ok to be miserable for the...... morning......BUT......... that in the afternoon you are going to do ............what ever will make you feel better for a while. Coffee with a friend, get your nails done, hit the shops big time ! or whatever can lift you for a while. It wont make it all go away ( if only) but it will make you see there are some good times still to be had. Lets see what the Mac person says.......just someone else, not involved , to talk to may help. Did you go to counselling ? Whatever happens....you ARE still here NOW.....so enjoy NOW as much as you can, everyday can hold some small precious moments.......and all these little things can just lift us up over the tip of the big hole, other wise known as depression. If none of that works.........................have a large glass of red wine, or the tiple of your choice. Sending you lots of virtual hugs...................................xxxx Sue
Posts.Title: bone scan today and yet another whinge from me.....a warning then...

Posts.Content: Thanks Judy, see I was confused. I am going to have another read of all my literature. I did know what was what......but thats seems to have got confused in my brain somehow !!!! Can't even blame the chemo now. Oh well just have to go back to blaming old age !!! And yes I am positive for both . Thanks and good luck xxx
Posts.Title: Herceptin AND Tamoxifen at the same time?

Posts.Content: Hi Having graduated from chemo I can honestly say , don't dread it, it is going to kick the cancer into touch, so it is your . Just like Blue Tit FEC for me was not too much of a problem , still functioned relatively normally , going out , working, even z holiday squeezed in. Don' t let us put you off with some of our stories / moans , the side effects, even of TAX are not compulsory, you don't have to get them, not all of us have. Even if you do get some side effects, if you get help straight away , there is normally something they can do to help. Remembering that it is kicking cancers butt kept me going on my down days , The treatment is temporary , it will pass , and it gets better . Honest Xxxx
Posts.Title: Weeks following mx

Posts.Content: Hi Lola         I was driving after 2 weeks MX and SNB but it does depend on your mobility. I was lucky i did not have any problems and could show the Surgeon i could twist, turn etc . I would wait until you see your Surgeon/Dr  next week and have a chat with her/him then.  Same applies re deodorant. Take care
Posts.Title: Deodrant

Posts.Content: Hi Kittycat. Most bank have accounts where you pay a monthly fee for all kinds of adds one that you do or don't need. Most if them include travel insurance as part if that deal. You may have to pay an additional fee to cover "c" related illnesses or decide not to bother. I am with Nat West and my account is Advantage Premier, they ANSI have Advantage Gold. Have a look at your Bank online. They are normally trying to get you to switch every time you go in the bank , and I don't have a problem with that , but most people don't know what they are paying for! Worth a try . I have a vision of the "outlaws" arriving, with one wheel on their wagon. ...... You probably have to be of a certain age to know that song...... But it will keep me smiling for a while. And I' m still rolling along !!!! Xxxxxx
Posts.Title: TRAVEL INSURANCE

Posts.Content: Hi Kittycat Do you have insurance with your Bank Account ? If not it might be worth switching accounts for a couple of months at least, the monthly fee is normally around £10pm.  Just check you are covered for "c", or take it up knowing that bit is not covered.    I don't work for a Bank so am not trying to flog it to you !!!!   Maybe in a different life. .    Have a great time anyway, you deserve it. Not long now. xx Sue
Posts.Title: TRAVEL INSURANCE

Posts.Content: Hiya.      As the others have said it is great your Mum has you alongside her during this time. Just being there is enough in itself. You can't make it better, we have all tried magic wands and they are not all they are cracked up to be !!  But you can just be there, ready to listen, hold her hand, laugh at some opportune or inopportune moments.  Re the scans. You can't second guess the results , others on here have had "suspect" scans, biopsies etc etc and in the end, things were ruled out....not necessarily ruled in. If that makes sense. the main thing is they are doing those tests. The waiting for any results is the pits....the absolute worst time. Once treatment starts in many ways it gets easier. My surgeon refuses to use the word cured for any of her patients as she does not have a crystal ball that works, how inconsiderate of her..........what they will be honest about is how treatable your Mums cancer is.  There are so many new treatments around nowadays and on the horizon that many many more cancers whilst not being cureable in the way we view them , are very very treatable. So, go make your Mum a cup of tea, give her a hug and just let here know you are there for her. The nurses on this site are soooooo good, give them a call tomorrow. xxxx   Sue  xxxx
Posts.Title: For my mum!!

Posts.Content: Hiya. Pineapple , fresh , tinned, juice. Helps with taste and cardboardness ! Difflam helped with dryness and hopefully prevent sore mouth. If your tongue gets whiteish get yourself to the Dr, he can give you nystatin and done antibiotics. Good luck. Xxx
Posts.Title: DRY MOUTH

Posts.Content: Hi Jenny If your tongue is coated with white , or your thrust, go to your GP . You don't have to wait for Monday, there should be weekend cover. My mouth an throat were sore and the mouthwashes did not get rid of it, because it was infected. The Dr gave me Nystatin and some tablets and within a few days it was much better. Don't take any chances , get it looked at. Xx. Sue
Posts.Title: sore mouth and throat

Posts.Content: Hi Add to the list .... Kurly Kale, Pak Choi , Brussels , Wow what a combination , no probs with constipation if I have all those !!!! I have been taking vitamin B12 , both surgeon and oncologist said it was ok . Dr s used to give my Mum injections every three months and the difference it made was dramatic, so I thought it was worth trying . Anyone know any different ? X Sue X
Posts.Title: A little Anemic

Posts.Content: Hi Squirrel I have probably been one if the ones that have been giving you the ebbie jeebies re TAX, and for that I am really sorry. It certainly does not affect everyone in the same way and I know I have said before the side effects are not compulsory . Also , if you do get anything they have something for most things, you just need to act quick enough. Most importantly in the big scheme of things it is all over relatively quickly , 9 weeks (tax bit) for me and most others ion FECT. Worrying about it , when it might not happen , is understandable but won' t change a thing. Just concentrate on where you are now and the next step along , the rest will happen anyway. Also...... As a post TAX survivor I can say life does get back to "normal" , my energy levels are almost back to ore chemo, my hair has grown and I am going without the wig, most of the aches and pains have disappeared , and the ones left I probably would have had anyway . So for all of those still waiting on the precipice ..... Don't worry ... Be happy .... As the song says........ It may never happen. XxxxxxxX
Posts.Title: 2 more FEC then 4 tax, i am in pieces worrying

Posts.Content: Hi Great to hear you are thru the chemo tunnel. My last one today and whilst I know that is not IT at least another hurdle completed . As you say I have found the weighted fake boob much better. I am 34h on one side ,so the heavieness evens me up. I am going to buy one of those softy bras you mentioned , have shied away from them thinking I might droop and both boobs end up on my knees. I have bought new underwiref bras , pretty ones, for special occasions,and made sure they had lots of lacy cup, so I could tuck the boob in.Not lost it yet but not tried jogging or anything too energetic, mainly because I have not got the energy. Good luck with your journies ladies XxxxxX. Sue
Posts.Title: Worried, told have to have delayed reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Annie You definitely should go and get checked out, if nothing else , for some peace of mind. Tax definitely makes you have the symptoms you have , but not eating and drinking probably has not helped, especially the drinking. That affects you physically and mentally . I know it is difficult to find anything you fancy when on chemo but you really do need to help your body get rid of the crap . Lemonade worked for me the lemony one, it actually tasted of something , someone rise in here said ginger beer. Try and have lots of different juices around to tempt you. Now when you lay your head down tonight .... Just think ....right...I am going to get this sorted tomorrow and then stop yourself going round in circles wondering what they will find. All the worrying in the world won't change a thing and is bad for your health !!!!! Stick with the known ........ You are going to do something about it tomorrow. Try to get some rest, that does not help either , not bring able to get a good nights rest . Sending you some hugs, strength and a few yawns to set you off. I void send you a Des O' Conner cd yo see if Taft sends you off, enough to put you in a self induced coma !!! Be good to yourself lady . Xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Going to ward tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Carol (Elder) Only just looked at this briefly.........so..... Mushrooms ? Liquorice (sp?) ?, Red wine ? (yipee), Tofu ? What else ? I do try to have as little fat and sugar as possible, Only have either Soya or Goats milk, sheeps cheese and butter. Which I keep to a minimum anyway I have lots of spinach/brocolli/curly kale and Pak Choi. have organic meats, very rarely red meat, mainly chicken. Lots of oily fish, mackerel and the like Having said that I am no angel ........I love chocolate so allow myself to be naughty, but make sure I have the "better" type, 70% cocoa. And try telling my Auntie , who is 83, that I really should not have Fresh Cream Apple Turnovers, so once a week I just give in and have one. Anything else ??
Posts.Title: cancer and diet

Posts.Content: Hi Shellay. Sorry you had to join our club, but glad you have found us. I am sure lots of the others will also welcome you on board this rollercoaster. I am sure you will find lots of information, advice and just general support .... From those who know his you are feeling. Some of us are quite a long way into our treatment , others just like you, recently diagnosed , so you will always have someone who knows what you are going through and what to expect. Just remember Cancer nowadays is just soooooo treatable. The worst bit is the waiting.... Where you are at now . No point saying don't worry, cause you will , but try and arrange something over the next few days to take your mind of "It". Don't google, stick to the Macmillan site , otherwise you will give yourself z heart attack instead !!!! Take care. Sue. Xxx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed last week- waiting for biopsy results

Posts.Content: Hi Lyn I really don't know enough to help you....except when I needed advice I rang the Mac nurses, explained what was wrong, and they certainly knew how to help. Also, I am sure others on here will give you some practical advice. I could say please don't worry before you have to......but I know that is almost impossible. Untill you have ALL the facts you really do not know what you are dealing with. One thing most of us have found is the fear of what might be, as well as the waiting for resuts/information, is the absolute pits....and does your brain in. Have a large glass of whatever takes your fancy,hot bath and lots of cuddles tonight. I am sure along with me the ladies on here are all thinking of you and sending you lots of hugs. Take care xxx

Posts.Content: Hi Sasha I have not replied to the posts over the last couple of days..... I am on a canal boat on the Avon and Kennett. Canal, Not exactly a relaxing holiday but ...... It sounds like you are S T R E T C H E D to breaking point. You need to do something to get rid of all the anger..... It won ' t make it go away but.... It will release some of it. A punch bag would be good ( if not the OH will do... Only joking !!!! )I It is never just one thing that sets us off. ....... Just the whole situation. Having or having had cancer changes everything... Talk about PMT ..... The emotional side of this is a bloody nightmare compared to the physical effects ( well for me anyway ). I am just as bad with my OH, he can ' t cope so ignores it most of the time, tells me it will soon.be over, then goes off and does something "practical", in other words something he CAN sort out. I have read Men R from Mars Women R from Venus, and I know the "story" but it still ticks me off , I don' t want to understand him.... I want to understand myself !!!!!!! Anyway...... Somehow , Someone,Somewhere, is going to cop it sometime when " we" let rip. Sorry everyone. I know I am not being fair or reasonable. But I don' t feel like it Not much space to hide away on this canal boat , who's idea was this ?????

Posts.Title: aaarrgh - day before ...

Posts.Content: Hi Annabelland Clare I thought I would just give you an update re my Tax/Doxcetacel experience so far. You have probably seen mine and previous post ..... and are dreading having your dose. Maybe it was going into the unknown again that made it worst. Sort of got used to FEC , and knew how I would react (sort of). I too had heard horror stories of Tax. I had my chemo on the Friday and was absolutely fine until the Monday. What I should have done on the Monday night was take my Tramadol as I was starting to ache. By the Tuesday morning I was aching really badly and it then took time to get the pain under control, then I was just achy for another 5 days. So a week in all. Again re my mouth infection ...... It started on the Wednesday and I just used the Difflam mouth wash and it was doing no good. I saw the pharmacist who gave me some over the counter lozenges .... Again in hindsight I should have seen the Dr then because it got worse and I ended up seeing the emergency Dr on the Saturday !! Once u was given the prescription mouth wash and antibiotics it began to get better , again it took about a week from beginning to end. So my longwinded point is ....... IF you do get any side effects, and maybe you won't......get help straight away.....no use in suffering when you don't have to. Try and get the Tramadol beforehand , and some poo juice , Movicol or something similar. After a horrible week I have honestly been fine..... Tired at times... But hey ho...... Nothing a good sit down can't site out . SO....... Now I know what my pastry might be....... Can't wait until Tuesday for round 2 !!!!! But at least there will then only be one left !!!!!! Yippee errrr Good luck to you both XxX
Posts.Title: Terrified of ONC appt tomorrow :(

Posts.Content: Hi Lindy Welcome to our club. None of us wanted to be here but we are all soooooo glad to be amongst "friends" . There will will be oldies ( in more ways than one) like me, newbies like you and some ladies bang in the middle of treatment, so someone will always be able to give advice, comfort ,a cuddle or a kick up the bum. Whatever you need!!! The waiting for things to happen is the worst time . Your mind goes into overdrive. Just don't let it go on Goggle! You will scare yourself silly. This Mac site is brilliant and the nurses so helpful and knowledgable . Once you are on the treadmill you will be surprised how quickly the weeks/ months go by. The good thing us they have caught the little do and do, are going to deal with it. Treatments are so much better and more are just around the corner , so compared to years ago , outcomes are extremely good. Hope to "see" you on here and it won't be long before you will be giving another newbie some advice. That's how it works , because the best thing we all help each other at some time or another . Good luck on your roller-coaster ride you have been pushed on !!! Xx Sue xX

Not as prescribed one , three times a day... She said I would not be able to sleep otherwise. I take 2 first thing in the morning and then the third one at lunchtime . I have not had trouble cleping. Posts.Title: aaarrgh - day before ...

Posts.Content: Hi Annie You most definitely are not moaning....... Just sharing. XxxX. And that is what we all do on here ... Everything crossed that the appointment/ news is not as bad as you fear. When I had my chemo last there was an inspirational lady there I was chatting to . She was diagnosed 7 yrs , nearly &8 yrs ago with breast cancer, but it was a secondary Eventually they found primary on her lungs. She underwent chemo and that was treated. She has had regular check ups and they picked up early cervical cancer, which she is now being treated for , chemo/ surgery. She was the most up beat person I have met and said the same as someone else on here recently ...... She has been "unlucky" to get cancer but.... it is now a very treatable disease .... Even if they can t say that magical word cureable she feels that with them keeping an eye on her she can continue to be treated. She was just so .... Dare I say.... Positive ( personslly i hate that word now!) .... As she said she could be one of those unlucky people who have an undiagnosed heart problem and just keel over and die. She said at least she has a chance of enjoying every day she is given. I hope that has not made you feel worse..... Maybe you have to have been there ......but I came away thinking well if it happens and" it "has spread....." It "can be dealt with ....and I can carry on living. Think of all of us behind you tomorrow, thinking of you. XxxxX

Posts.Title: Terrified of ONC appt tomorrow :(

Posts.Content: Hi Lizzie That's the trouble with having all the information about side effects..... You imagine you will get them all . You won't. I am not saying you won't get any..... But any you do get can be treated providing you seek help . I was not on your regime. I was on FECT + Herceptin . Can't say it has been the best experience of my life..... But you know what..... I got through it with more good days than bad.. And I am still standing And hopefully am now cancer free, so it has been worth the roller coaster ride. Don't panic. Be aware of what MIGHT happen , but don't over worry about something that may not happen.. One if the others will come along with more "cuddles" for you . Take care .... Xxx
Posts.Title: Any comments/help appreciated

Posts.Content: Go girl.... You have some catching up to do . BUT talk to the Dr's about your meds. I asked to taken of the anti sickness , can't remember the name but it is Met.......cyline(?). That made me spaced out for about 3-4days, changed me to Doperidone , and that did the trick . Things can only get better..... Another song there somewhere. Have a good weekend. Xx
Posts.Title: Hooray...and up she rises!

Posts.Content: Hi Elder Hr2 positive in my minds eye means at least they know why my cancer happened and now days they have the drugs to deal with it. Yes, it does mean the word aggressive is used, but in medical terms that does not mean quite the same as we "hear" the word. It is not running rampant.... Just that the cells divide quicker than in non hr2 positive cancers. So I am pleased to be having Herceptin and then Arimidex.... To me that means something is/will help protect me in future. XxxX. Try not up worry toooooo much, it won' change anything and will make you feel worse . Easier said than fine I know XxxxxX

We all have different ways of coping with the devastating news that we have BC......somehow e all get through.... One step at a time. Take care XxxxX

Posts.Title: Hi, I'm new

Posts.Content: Hi Cathy I dont have the answer as to why you have TAX but please be assured not everyone has had bad side effects on the dreaded TAX. Some people find FEC worse.It is indivdual....you may sail through it. You will get lots of advice on here on how to protect yourself against the worst of the POSSIBLE (not a forgone conclusion) side effects.Good luck....from someone who has finished chemo....and survived ! xxSue
Posts.Title: TAC Question......

Posts.Content: Hi. I had 6 fibro adenomas (?sp) removed between the ages if 14 and 32. I am now 58. I had been to myGP 6 months prior to diagnosis in march this year ,as I felt a lump near one of my old scars. He said nothing to worry about, only scar tissue. After routine mammogram 6 months later .. 3x lumps found . 2 were then found to be invasive ductsl carcinoma . So I don't know if one leads to another or makes you more susceptible to getting BC .... Having my little lumps removed does not seemed to have stopped me getting this bloody disease. I am more annoyed with myself for not standing up to my GP when he virtually told me i was being daft . I won't let that happen again..... Good luck anyway XxxxxxxX Sue
Posts.Title: has any body else had a similiar experience

Posts.Content: Well done you. The hardest thing is making the decisions, it feels that someone else should do that for you. If it is any help I think you have made the right decision....throw everything you can at the little blighter....if not you would always wonder. It is only a few months of unpleasantness, dealable with help, for the long term gain. Every % counts. If you are usually fit and relatively healthy you will deal with it all. One step at a time . Good luck... It is a rollercoastr ride, lots if highs and lows, use this site to rant, rave and seek the help u roll need along the way..... It is great . Xx
Posts.Title: Chemo - decision made

Posts.Content: Sooooooo good to hear GOOD NEWS. I have only just started my journey....I keep saying I feel like I am entering a tunnel ....just don't know how long it is....and sometimes, just sometimes can't see the light at the end of the tunnel. So it is good to hear someone has been there, got the tee shirt.......and wearing it with pride. Thanks
Posts.Title: low confidence issues :0(

Posts.Content: Oh Sassy....you made me cry !!!!! That is exactly how I am feeling..... Not only will this b@@@d disease not get me.....I will come out of it better. We are both at the early part of the journey and I am sure we will have bad days but so long as we can visualise the end of the roller coaster ride we will get there. Good luck x
Posts.Title: friends and family freaking me out :(

Posts.Content: Hiya Girlies Thought it was just me having those type of thoughts /problems !!!! Not really. BUT it seems like that sometimes. We are all going through traumatic times at the moment and it is hardly suprising that we are less tolerant....there is only a certain amount of patience to go around ....and the big "c" certainly takes up the lions share. It has not helped that I am reading a self help book that tells me to rid myself of anything that gets in the way of my dealing with my illness. Basically telling me to put myself first. Cut everything else out. So when "him indoors" moans because he has slept in an awkward position and has a stiff neck..... all day , on and on.....by evening time...when he has the flicker and has chosen theTV program to watch.......and then promptly falls asleep.... I keep having to tell myself....don't get stressed....but it is easier to say...Urghhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh, strop off to bed, yes seperate rooms, light off......when he comes in to give me a kiss goodnight, a peck on the cheek, I respond....my Dad used to kiss me goodnight like that, turn over. I do accept that we are BOTH stressed over what is going on at the moment....and to be fair neither of us know how to deal with it. At some point I will have to explain how I feel and get him to talk...but at the moment I just do not feel like doing that. Why does it always have to be me ????? Now that was a big looooooooong winded way of saying.......YOU ARE NOT ALONE .....and it is hardly suprising. Maybe counselling would help....but form e that is a diversion I do not want to go down at the moment. We will get through......somehow. xx Take care xx Keep smiling :>))
Posts.Title: Relationships and cancer

Posts.Content: Hiya Lady in Red I know what you mean............I have taken to saying.........."it is so nice to have someone like you XXXX who talks to me normally, about normal things and not Cancer, it seems to work , they take the hint. Good luck on this roller coaster ride.Take care , keep smilig :>))

Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: Hi Just returned from Reflexology..... Really relaxing me time. Strongly recommend taking up the NHS offer i of free sessions. Good to have something to look forward to with no drugs/needles .... Just pure relaxation.
Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: Hi Annie I have missed out on some of the posts but you do seem better now that you have other things to focus on . I did see someone's post on CBT and do agree that somehow we have to find a "positive" ( that seems to be an emotive word at the moment ) in all of our "issues" . That is not saying everyone has to go round with smiley faces even when they feel crap or are sick and tired of this whole "c" thing. But...... If you had not put on your post about feeling like you are back at square one..... You may not have booked your Reflexolgy..... And even if you don't find that is for you..... It may lead to something else, Indian head massage is brilliant too. I like Irenes idea of throwing cups.....something physical works for me ... I normally stomp off and walk the dogs for miles.... Can't do that at the moment , as I am so knackered .... Might be more expensive to stock up old cups etc but less taxing . Enjoy the little things you have planned and the fact you are wrenching control back from the professionals who think they know what I'd best for you ..... Without fully involving you in the process. Give them hell. Xxxxx Sye. xxxxxX
Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: Hi Kittycat My BCN gave me are referal form for Alternative Therapies, who are based at a nearby hospital. I get 4 free. Lots of choice . Have had Acupunture and Reflexolgy ( today) . Both really relaxing . Just having an hour of pampering with no interruptions , calm music, lovely candle smells , is just soooooo worth it. I will pay to have further sessions later. Re the results side of things.... Until they did surgery with me my plan was surgery then rads. Because when they went in and removed the cancer they found a micro amount in my lymph node ...... It was all change.. And I ended up having to have chemo. No rads as they were happy that they got clear margins,which means they were able to get each lump out clear of any other organs , and in my case the chest wall . They did not tell me before things could change , not sure if this was better or not.... Ignorance us not always bliss Don't worry toooo much....there is not a lot you can do until you get the results.... then "whatever" will be dealt with . Oh dear..... That sounds awful..... But my late husband used to say ..... Worry about the things you can control and do something about..... Let others worry about the things you can't change . Take cae.
Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: Hi. Don't wait for it to get worse , that was what I did, and then it takes time to get it under control. With the painkillers it is an a he, without them pain. Just be careful with your mouth as well, at the first sign of any whiteness on the roof of your mouth or tongue go see your GP , they have stronger stuff rhan can be bought over the county. Once I had this I felt much better. I all , I was "not right" for about a week, but since then have been fine ( fingers crossed) ...... So it is do able. Hope you feel better soon xxxx Sue
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Title: Cold Cap. Does it work?

Posts.Content: Hi You are a little ahead of me.... Good Luck , let me know how you get on. Take care  xx
Posts.Title: Cold Cap. Does it work?

Posts.Content: Annie You are definitely not bringing any of us down...... We all just wish there was more that we could do for you . We all have our days of doubts/ downers ..... And I know you have given sound advice to other when they have been on the same place. You know the "waiting" is the worst time, yours( and all of our ) minds go into overdrive and invariably we come up with answers that are far worse than the reality . Whatever your results they will deal with "it" and I bet you are on this site saying your news is better than you thought . Find something to keep you busy ovr the next few days.. Something nice. Something all encompassing. Don't leave yourself to much time to think..... And if you do .... Allocate x amount of time to feeling down and then go out for a walk... Do some shopping, not the boring food stuff . And don't go looking on the computer anymore. I wish I was able to do more but big virtual hugs will have to do Xxxxxxxxx :-0. xxxxxxxxxxxX

Posts.Content: Hi Karen Sounds similar to me. The effects are different between FEC/tax but manageable , once you know what you ate managing and keep on top of. Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hiya Kittycat Good luck to you tomorrow., Did i say before to suck ice cubes during chemo, nurse said it might stop the mouth getting sore. Made mine up...and forgot them !!! had them when I got home . Finger crossed 4 u xx Sue xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Just seen my Oncologist today for check up, one month following last chemo. He was not suprised I was still feeling tired/achy. He said my bloods had gone down substantially during chemo and would take time to recover. How long ????? He did not know, great !!! What is more worrying is that he does not want to see me again until NEXT SEPTEMBER. The surgeon will see me in MARCH, when I will have a Mamogram on the remaining boob. I have seen lots of posts on here about feeling lost after treatment but i just feel bloody angry at the moment that just 6 months after surgery ....that is it. I will still be having Herceptin and will now start taking Arimidex but just thought there would be more monitoring. But when I said that he said no.....it would be symtom lead from now on.....in other words you have to show signs of "something" before they do anything else. Maybe I am being paranoid but... as I am still feeling knackered all the time, having pains in my joints as well as upper back between my shoulders......I would have thought another interim appointment would have been sensible. Thats it rant over....back to you, whilst they have said your bloods are ok.....that might mean OK bearing in mind you have just finished chemo, so they would expect them to be on the low side. Ask them what the norm is and what yours are. It won't change anything...but at least you will know why you are so tired. Then it is just time, good eating, lots of iron rich food etc. I sympathise....it is horrible being so shattered all the time. Big hug xx Sue
Posts.Title: Docetaxal - how long until you feel better??!!

Posts.Content: Hi As all the others have said, having your hair shaved off does not hurt. The lady who cut my wig did it for me. It was a bit of a shock to see myself with the shortest hair ever but great not to find it in the sink/bath/pillow and no more itching/pulling sensation. My grandchild,8, saw me wigless this weekend and said I looked a bit like a boy, a pretty boy, but a boy. Bless kids ... You can trust their honesty! BUT. On the positive side she said I looked like Nanny Sue(me) with my wig on and kept getting it for me when we went out... So at least I now the wig looks good. I am sure your Mum fill be ok whatever she decides. She is lucky to have you, keep up the good work sweet pea.x
Posts.Title: very tender scalp due too chemo...suggestions?

Posts.Content: Count me in ...... I think !!!!! At the moment I resemble that girl on the advert who comes on ...removes shoes, clothes, false boob, hair ...... And now to add to it.......I have had to add my front tooth is removable......lovely. Eating my brekkie on Monday and CRACK.... Front crown snapped. Tooth fractured inside it !! Panic as I was day 5 post chemo and possible infection probs!! Before dentist could see me chemo dept told me I needed my bloods checked, platelets etc. At least that was all ok but now have to have a bloody horrible "plate" with one tooth on.. Until new crown ready. So I don t know if the world is quite ready for an almost bald , lopsided, gummy 57 yr old .... I know I'm not !!! Cried more over the tooth than the boob going AWOL Night night xxxx

Posts.Title: don't know what the hell to think anymore : (

Posts.Title: How to make a woman going through chemo feel so much better...

Posts.Content: Hi Annie When I was on Tax everything ached from about day 5 for about 10 days, On top of that I had a nasty tickly, wheezy feeling in my chest and felt sort of short of breath. Walking the dogs went from 3-4 mile walk to struggling to take them round the block for a piddle and poo ! I was sooooo out of breath. To be honest it took until about 9 weeks after chemo finished for me not to feel like that. So I think it is probably the Tax but if you are really worried, and not comforted by what I ......and others I am sure will add......talk to the your GP/Oncologist. Between us I am sure we can put your mind at ease. xxxxx big hugs xxxxx Sue

Posts.Title: just had mastectomy and full node clearance- daughter has hand foot...

Posts.Content: Hi Annie Sooooooooo glad you got the news you wanted . What a difference a day a day makes. :0). XxxxxxX
Posts.Title: never thought would be so happy to have surgery!!

Posts.Content: Received..... You are back Pollycat. Hope you are reading this post on the morning after a decent nights sleep. My chemo nurse told me to take all my steroids in the morning... Even though the label said 3x a day, she said it would help me get some sleep and I didn't have too many problems. For me FEC 2&3 were better. They changed my anti sickness tablets and whilst I still felt unwell on night 1 I was much better afterwards.Tiredness does increase as you go along, well it had for me, but as long as I could take little breaks, stop and do nothing for a while, I seemed to recover well. On Doxcetacel now and that is a different story..... Maybe some other time !!!! Sleep tight. XxxxX
Posts.Title: Chemo started already!

Posts.Content: Hi  Juliea   Sorry you have had to find us but welcome anyway. At the moment your head is either going round and round in circles ( not literally, that not a a sign of BC !!!), or it will feel like its all happening to someone else.  Either way, it won't change where you are right now.There will be others coming on here who I am sure will back me up..............the being told you have or almost certainly have BC ............. but no treatment plan as yet, is the absolute worst time.  Your mind will go into overdrive.  Please don't Google, just stick to the Macmillan and Breast Care sites, they are safe, if not you will frighten yourself silly.  Talk to you Link Nurse or they may give you a Breast care Nurse to talk to.They are so helpful, normally. You will probably have to wait 7-10 days for the biopsy results, then you will move forward. Until then you are sort of treading water.  Try and do something that will take your mind off of all this for a few days, sounds impossible but you can get times when you are not thinking about it all the time. There are lots of support groups, and of course this site and the briiliant on line Nurses are here to help you along the line.  We are a varied bunch, from all over the UK and beyond, different ages, diagnosis, treatments, let alone views, beliefs and ways of expressing ourselves etc etc et,........... but we all have one aim..........to kick cancers butt.  Along with that we help each other, by listening, sharing , having a cry or a laugh together. So once again welcome to our not so little club. So, go do something nice, outrageous, daft or all three rolled into one. let us know how you get on. xxx sue  xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed - feeling lost

Posts.Content: Hi Kittycat I know what you mean ..... You really don t want anyone else to feel like this ... But it is comforting to know it is "normal" . Before I went away to Spain I got a copy of all my blood test from when I started chemo and my red blood cell count had gone down almost half .... So I understood why I was knackered ..... So maybe I will ask for a blood test next week when I see the oncologist .... Just to make sure things are going in the right direction now . This thing is NOT going to ruin my life .... Good luck on your recovery..... Let me know if you find a way of getting some energy.... I am trying yo eat spinach ..... It worked for Popeye. My friend gave me a recipe for a juice.... Apple, pear, spinach and cabbage !!!!! Does not taste as bad as it sounds ..... Maybe that and my vit b12 will do the trick . XxxxX Sue
Posts.Title: Chemo ends - Where's the wine and the tissues?!!!

So it is not just going to recover straight away ....... Patience is not my strong point, Good luck to all those post chemo.... And those still on that journey..... We are all proof you do get through it . Xxxx
Posts.Title: Chemo ends - Where's the wine and the tissues?!!!

Posts.Content: I know it is the waiting that is the worst....I feel for you......Somehow we find the strength to deal with the "whatever"....just not the unknown. Hope your news is good and you can celebrate on holiday. Thinking of you x

Posts.Content: Good to have you back. Now..... Where are Sassy/Saxxy.... So I can confuse the two of you again !!!!! The sun is shining I am going to have a better day
Posts.Title: Not sure if I still belong here or not?

My sister in law has primary lympodema and has to do feather light stroke uo her arms towards the heart. Also she was told to raise her arms/arms to help drainage. Thats all I know. Posts.Title: Arm swelling - what can I do to prevent lymphodema?

Posts.Content: Hiya Don't you dare go anywhere young lady. WE all need and give different perspectives on this bloody awful disease . WE all understand your reasoning for staying well clear of chemo. With your health issues YOU made the choice, that makes it right for you. I dreaded chemo (and still do), I saw the effects on my husband, so was not over enthusiastic about embarking on something I knew was going to make md feel ill, up until chemo I felt well ! BUT because I was relatively fit and healthy I did a deal with myself.....so long as the side effects were bearable I would go on with chemo. If it got to the point it was affecting my quality of life I would stop and seek other ways of protecting myself. I have not ducked out yet but feel i have been lucky.... So far. I am sure everyone here wishes you al the best ,I had sent you a PM , asking how/what your treatment was , let me know at sometime. So....... Don't stay away. XxxxxX
Posts.Title: Not sure if I still belong here or not?

Posts.Content: Hi The choice you have made, and mulled over, and the decision you made is your personal decision and now made I am sure you will feel "better" (stupid thing to say !), but i Hope you know what I mean. I was reluctant to go for chemo, did the same ummming and errrrring, and thought, well if I really did not get on with chemo,if the negatives were more than the possible positives.......well I would tell them to stop. I too am HER2 +8/9 and was also was told that Herceptin was on offer WITH chemo. Iam now 2/3rds of the way through and up until last week had not had a single regret. Bad week last week but much better now. All vital signs are holding up.....and they do check you regularily, heart,liver,kidney etc. So hopefully you are relatively fit to start with and will continue that way.Good Luckxxx Sue
Posts.Title: Not sure if I still belong here or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Ejder. I know how you feel. Even so far down the line we need that bit of comfort, reassurance and certainty that all that can be done, is and has been done and the beast has gone . AND in my case want to draw a line in the sand and say " I don't have cancer anymore". Every time I get near to that point I seek assurance by asking another question that I put to the Oncologist/Surgeon and am not given the answer I want/need. Like... I am strongly hormone positive. So it seems logical to me that they check my hormone levels to see that they are reducing with the medication I am taking and changes I have made to my diet. Answer, no they don't check. Why ? They are symton lead from now on . I am going to see my GP , I have read they can test for Hormone imbalance and even if I have to pay for it I want it done. Same re scans . I have not had any MRI/CT scans. I am due my first annual mammogram on 4th Feb . So I asked what they were going to do re the left side , where I had MX. Answer , nothing, they are symptom lead. !!!! They do not scan as the likelihood is nothing will show. So my brain says well why do mammogram then. ? So.... I going to put this to my GP , poor thing. I appreciate that these things may be a waste of time but I too want to be able to say with conviction .... I am a survivor.....accepting there are no guarantees and any tests just prove at that point in time I am ok. I feel I could then move on. A lot of what I feel is about control and taking some of that back and I strongly feel that the mind has a lot of effect on how we deal / get through this disease, how we recover and how we survive. I am reading a good book called Getting Well Again which is all about how we participate in our own health/ recovery. I have not got to that Nirvana point yet..... Not finished the book yet or practised all the techniques it suggest...... But my main thing at the moment is to get the professionals , who I do trust clinically, to understand the emotional needs are as important as they affect the physical being. Having re read all of the above.... It sounds daft / neurotic / paranoid !!!! But hey ho that's me. ..... So in a longwinded way , in reply to your question... I don't know !!!! ...... If you find the answer please enlighten me. In the meantime I am going to enjoy each day, things are better , so I am trying to concentrate on living . Have a great day . I am off to walk the dogs in the snow .
Posts.Title: When does survival start officially?

Posts.Content: Hi. I was given a lovely heart shaped pillow by my Breast care nurse gave me . It was brilliant for tucking under my arm just after my boob was removed ! Something like that helps sooooo much Xxx

Posts.Title: Docetaxel / Finger nails

Posts.Content: Hiya Don't want to talk too soon but had Doxce on Friday and have felt better than on FEC......maybe not had the time to get to grips with me yet. No sickness, which I had with FEC. Evem went out for a Thai meal last night. A little bit tired but nothing like the spaced out feeling I got with FEC, What bit of hair I had has started to come out again in the shower this morning...but hey ho the damage had already been done. Will be starting my injections tonight to increase my white blood cell count....and thee nurse did warn that might make me ache more. But honestly at the momemt It is no where near as bad as i thought....especially about reading about the others bad reactions. I too have Tramadol in the wings but have not even had to take paracetomol/ibuprofen. Also have Diclefenic ,just in case I get the tingly/neuopathic (?) feelings.........and this from someone who hates pills....I don't care i am NOT going to suffer if I don't have too.Good Luck....positive vibes coming your way xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxal question

Posts.Content: You should be offered the cap, which increases your chances if not losing your hair. They reckon about 50/50. It is like an old fashioned motor cycle helmet attached to a refrigeration unit, which that the cap to -6 degrees. I have gad it on the one FEC chemo I have had. It was do able and as has been said the first 10-15 mins are the worst, after that it was ok. Still have my hair , although it is thinning. I feel/felt it was worth a try. It does add time to the session a you have to be "frozen" and "defrosted", but mine was 1/2hr before and after. Good luck either way . X
Posts.Title: First chemo tomorrow

Uncomfortable for a few days but honestly really do able, did not even need paracetol! I had mastectomy. Ue this site. And the Macmillan info site, both are briillianf, don' t worry about being a Iain to anyone , the Vreast Care Bmurss are also there for any little nightly thoughts that can escalate to gigantic issues if left to fester. Posts.Title: Feeling nervous of my first fec chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Just thought I would let you know I also had a portacath fitted....thank goodness. It was soooo much easier each time I had chemo and now Herceptin. No digging around for veins. My arms are still recovering from the 3 sessions I had before it was fitted. The fitting was ok. Under GA, in and out same day. Only less than an inch incision. I have not had pain from it, and whilst I can't say I don't know it is there, it has not stopped me sleeping. I jiggle around until I find I am comfy, and can sleep on either side. It really was the best thing for meto have done and makes the treatment so much easier. Good Luck. xxx

With FEC you should find you pick up soon , it affected me the first week, the next week I started to feel "better" then the third week , almost normal. Ready for next session !!!! Don't put up with dude effects, talk to your GP , Breast Care Nurse if you are feeling nauseous if being dick, you don't have to put up with it. The time will fly by, honest . You can rant and rave here without upsetting your loved ones . Sometimes we even gave a laugh !!! I am sure there was a thread on here recently for younger ladies with BC and maybe one of the youngsters can give you the link to this . Welcome to the club no one wants to be in . Take good care of yourself . Xxx Sue xxx

My oncologist is going to get the full list of what went on when I see him this Thursday. I too seriously thought.... I can t do this .... Or more like I won t do this . Posts.Title: Fed up and depressed

Posts.Content: Hi Annie YES YES YES TAX is the pits......OFFICIAL (sorry to all those of you still to start, It does not affect everyone as bad....but when it does it is a total B@@@@@td) It makes you feel so ill , everything is such an effort. I did get out of puff just going up any slight incline.....and I mean even theraised curbs !! and I all but gave up walking my dogs for a couple of months. But...... even worse it seems to affect you emotionally. I was forever in tears , and I really don't do tears , feeling I could not go on, and this was IT. You have a lot to contend with, it is hardly suprising you feel the way you do. How far are you through this planned treatment ? 8 days post tax means you are probabaly at your lowest ebb. Acknowledge that, it helps you understand why you feel so crap....it is not you it is what the drugs are doing to you. Good and Bad !! It helped me when i saw the chart with all of my blood test results......everything was going in the wrong direction,each session it got worse........ it is what they expect, but somehow that made me understand what my body was trying to cope with. No wonder we feel so ill. BUT>>>>>>It is only temporary, you will get to the end of this treatment, and once it stops you will start to feel better......slowly but surely. Take heart from knowing you are not the only one this bloody concontion has affected in this way.....it wont make you feel physically better but might just help mentally. Big hugs and ....ooops nearly said positive vibes !!!!!.....but mean....we are all with you willing you on through this torture that WILL send this dam awful disease packing. Take care. xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Posts.Title: Worrying scan results

Posts.Content: Hiya Shelley I did not believe people either!!!! But it honestly is not bad, of I could swap my chemo for your op I would. You have done the hardest bit. I am sure you will be in and out before you realise it !! I had no pain, did not have to take anything when I got home, and they only gave me Parecetemol in hospital. I was able to get up to go to the toilet, the nurse walked with me just in case I was wobbly. So no bed pan. Yes, the drains are a nuisance, but just that, and they don't like to leave them in too long normally. No one is more clumsy than me and I survived without tripping over them ! They were out on day 3 post op. I took my own towel and wishy washy things , including deodorant , which I could use under the unaffected arm. Get a gentle stick one. Easy access to your PJs, I night button ups but those stretchy best ones are just s good. Do your exercises , they will give you a booklet . Will be thinking of you tomorrow. Take care and let us all know how you get on.

Posts.Title: Just diagnosed!

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca Sorry the FEC ing Fec has not done it's job....this disease is so individual, what works for one does not work for all. Docetaxol is definatley a more aggresive chemo drug and hopefully will do the trick. They just have to find the one that works for you and kicks the invaders into touch. He, the Oncologist, proabably beleives Docetaxol will work and thats why he was dismissive. Another case of the proffessionals not being a good people person(s). They did not keep me for the full 6 hrs on my first Herceptin....they just need to make sure you do not have a reaction. After the first dose I now have the Herceptin and Docetaxol together, so you will get back into a routine again. Just a blip....not a nice one ....but better to get this sorted now and on to a regime that WILL work, than to keep pumping something into you that is ineffective. Go do something nice now.....take your mind of "IT" for a while. Take care xxx Sue xx

Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothee , Saxxy ,Blue Tit . Sasha and everyone else Wow , your sentiments , and how you have expressed them made me cry, not totally in sadness for Annie but also in a way for everything we have been , and still are going through,, each and everyone of us. Posts.Title: Feels empty here

Posts.Title: Feels empty here

Posts.Content: Hi  Jenny and Ethel and all on this thread   Well if we are talking size.....I was/am 34JJ,(now only 1 is ).   I understand exactly where you are coming from. I totally hate being lopsided, and the remaining boob looks sooooo big and odd now. 1st thing in the morning is the worst before I put my falsie on. Not a good look.  Yes I have had to re think my wardrobe, lots had to go, some tops have to have a cami under now. I know I look ok once "dressed". I have said this before , I would prefer to have two flatties than be like this but at the moment that is not an option, neither is reconstruction. I don't think it is unusual/ unreasonable to feel as we do.   What keeps me from going stir crazy is that all of the crap I (we) have gone through has given me the best  chance of living.  I made that choice.....I want to live, when I was diagnosed, and having gone through all that chemo could chuck at me.........I feel even more determined this bloody disease will not win. Just like I am now  feeling better physically I am sure I will also find the way emotionally. The other option is not an option.  Life is worth it, even when its crap. re Swimming, I managed to stay afloat, and not capsize. I swam without a falsie, but only because I was in the pool by myself. I am going to get myself a proper waterproof  falsie. I bought a couple of mastectomy swimming costumes which I tried with my non waterproof boobie and they looked OK. No it is not the same as before............. but it is a choice of giving up something I enjoy or making the best of what I have.  I wish I had a choice but I haven't. re Getting comfy. I can honestly say I now have found a way of sleeping comfortably. I used to always have those orthopaedic pillows but found I had to buy a soft one if I want to sleep on  "that" side. So i have them like a V shaped one. So I have a hard one on side , soft on the other. It works for me. You will find your way. I don't want to come across as Mrs Positive, because I really really am not but I cannot afford to let this "thing" get the better of me.  Good luck........................Things will get better......somehow !!!!!!!!!    xxxxx  Sue   xxxxx
Posts.Title: body image

Posts.Content: Hi All HEALTH WARNING............... googling anything to do with breast cancer, especially in the wee hours of the morning, is detrimental to you health !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I am one of those who just have to know the ins and outs of everything.... but..............I won't let myself do late night research...there is no one else to ask if you don't like what you have read...any sane ( or BC free person) is safely tucked up in bed snoring !!! Use the daylight hours...you can then talk to someone else....BC Nurse, Macmillan, and most important....this site. Get "it" into perspective. Take care all.

Posts.Title: 2nd recurrence in 2 years.

Posts.Content: oooooooooooooooh  Turkey sounds soooo good, warm sunshine, lovely. The sun is out here today but it is freeeeezing, a lovely breeze coming in off the North Sea ! Any room in your suitcase ?? I went to Spain 2 days after my last chemo. Probably not the best holiday I have had but it made me feel good. I booked the assistance thing and got ferried to and from the plane, there is no way I could have walked halfway around Gatwick !!! not after Doxcetaxcel !!! We were in avilla so I did not have to worry about being lopsided, bald, no eyebrows and walking like I wet myself. Could eat what I liked....or not. So it worked for me.     Go for it.         xxxxxx      Sue    xxxxx
Posts.Title: new year onwards and upwards

Posts.Content: Hi. What a sweetie you are . Your Mum must be so proud of you . I can tell you that your Mum will deal with whatever this diagnosis chucks at her ..... Because she wants to kick the little blighter into touch, and that makes it all worthwhile. She will have her down days but funnily enough " it " also gives some amazing highs, and I am sure you will be one if those highs, just by being there. You don't even have to do anything, although the odd cup of something or an unexpected visit /treat won't do any harm ! You need to keep yourself sane , it us often worse for those around us..... So be kind to yourself as well . Use this site.... It is a great to relieve some if the tension and I know the Mac people are always happy to talk to families going through this with their loved ones, and they are a fountain if information/ advice/comfort. So use it all . Take care . Xx Sue xX
Posts.Title: Help.

Posts.Content: Hi Ice lollies, ice cream, pineapple in any form, fresh , tinned, juice. Some say ginger . If it gets to the stage your tongue goes white , see your GP, they have mouth washes etc they can give you. It lasted for about a week each time. I am sure other will be along soon to give some other tips. oh yes, drink lots, water !!!!! Take care. It will pass, it is temporary.   Sue xx

Posts.Title: 14 months later :-))

Posts.Content: Hi all I don't post here much now . I still dip in and out for updates on how you are all going along . It is good to see the new friendships being made . I hope you make as good friends as I did. It is amazing how something so horrid can bring us together . I just wanted you to know there is light at the end of the tunnel My mx was in mar 12 and I recovered really well . Still hate being lopsided but happier to be alive . Chemo took its toll , finished in sept 12 , and it took longer than I anticipated for me to get my strength back . I still have weary days.... But I think that happened before BC and I just carried on regardless.. not now.. I give myself time to recharge my batteries . The hair comes back , nails re grow , toes feel less like they belong to someone else Mentally I have had a few melt downs post treatment but that's hardly surprising is it !!! Acknowledging the actual trauma if what happened seemed to hit me months after chemo finished but I feel I have come out if that phase a stronger person. I am still on Herceptin until July , so that's my next goal. No more 3 weekly trips to the hospital and sniffly nose for a fees days after . My port can come out . Anastrazole has its high and lows but for me apart from the initial night sweats it had been doable . I know others have not be so lucky .... But there are always other options . Reconstruction or not ???? That can wait. I want to enjoy being the new me for a while. Wishing you all ......some peace amongst the mayhem of the rocky road ......some joy from getting over the hurdles this disease has us jumping ......some hope that you have the better of the unwanted invader . ......some new / improved friendships , made in adversity but which will I am sure stand the test of time . Take care. Xxx ......

Posts.Title: 14 months later :-))

Posts.Content: Hi Pollycat Please don't worry....I hate needles but managed to do these all by myself. The chemo nurse showed me once and then I did them. As Debra said you need to do it one side one day , the other side the next and so on. My injecttions were so easy. The hardest part was getting the needle out the packet !!!. It did not hurt going in and was spring loaded so the needle went straight back into the cartridge. They have to be kept in the firdge before use, other than that I promise you it is ok. I did mine just before I went to bed and I took a paracetemol, just in case I got lower back pain, only did once. It is worth it.....to protect you from getting infections. XXSueXX

Posts.Title: Wound still leaking after MX

Posts.Content: Hi I am sure you did not offend anyone .... We have all been there and know how the mind ....and mouth work !!! Still you had good news... That is great. I too knew i had DCIS and as it was in two (they thought 3 areas, left, right and centre ) places MX was the surgical option . I asked for both boobs to be done but they flatly refused , but have heard on this site bothers have bern luckier, if that is you feel lucky having to have it in the first place. !!!! Just think post op ....the bloody "c" will be gone, history , It was thought I would then have radiotherapy but my sentinel mode had micro metatases so I was "offered" chemo. That was something I dreaded but it does improve my chances of it not spreading. The surgeon said no scan would pick up any lurking seefdlings hiding elsewhere in the body now or maybe for even a few years and it is my insurance policy. So I have gone along with it 4 down 2 to go. Honestly it has not been anywhere near as bad as I thought , not great but do able. The surgery was also much much better than you can imagine, honest . So.... Just wait and see.... Easier said than down I know.... But my bubbie used to say worry about things you can do something about... So busy yourself organising for your op , lots of tips about what to take etc that I cm somebody the other ladies will chip in with. Do something nice... The sun is shining , get yourself out doing whatever makes you feel good , it will take your mind of "it " for a while anyway. :0). XxxX
Posts.Title: new and scared...

Posts.Content: Hi Sam It is horrible when they keep moving the goalposts . Just get tomorrow over with .... And get healed up !!!!! I have just gone from March to now Left Boobless , I can t tell you it is great but ..... The main thing is you kick the cancer into touch. I would love to say you won t mind.... But you will....But the time goes soooooo quickly, with so many appts, for chemo/rads , time will fly by. .Honest. I have been told I will have to wait at least a year, until my Herceton finishes , before they will do reconstruction . It is stil bloody annoying but I have to go with what the doctors recommend, I have to put my faith in them . Take care. XxxxxxX. Big hug.

Posts.Title: One week post Tax and no appetite

Posts.Content: Hi I too was offered this trial , under no pressure though. I had been told that the margins from my MX were good and I would not be offered radiotherapy . The Oncologist went through the possible side effects of the radiotherapy and the possible benefit , which seemed mainly they it reduces the risk of the cancer returning to the same site . Having been given chemo as my insurance policy against any "seedlings" left lurking anywhere in the body ..... I decided against joining the trial. I did feel a big guilty and sometimes wonder if I should have gone ahead with it..... Just in case . But. I just wanted my "treatment" ovr and done with.... Although I am still on Herceptin and have just started Aromidex !!!! I have been on two other trials so I have done a little bit to help the cause !!!!! Good luck with your decision.. Do what is right for you . XxSue

Posts.Title: Supremo Trial for Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Kipper   I dont use the site so much nowdays,but still log in every now and then. Your title rang a bell with ,e. this time last year i was feeling the same. Honest. Having gone on the rollercoaster ride I now feel like I am on a more sedate merry go round ! I had a Mastectomy , Chemo and am still on Herceptin until July. Also on Anastrozole tablets for 5 yrs. All I can say is it does get better, somehow.......don't know how sometimes, but you do get through it. And it is sooooooooooooo worth it. Use this site.....it helps so much to have someone....and there is always someone, whatever time of day/night, that knows EXACTLY how you are feeling, and can give some practical advice. If not definately some moral support. It works. Where abouts are you.?  Apart from making "virtual" friends here on Macland, I have also made some really brilliant friends who are local, and we meet up for coffee and a natter every now and then. Try and think about the next step....one step at a time....it becomes too much if you try and think of it all at once. So many things rushing around in your brain.  PM me if you want. I am sure you will find others who are around about the same stage of treatment but it might be nice to know someone who has been there and done it...........almost !!!
Posts.Title: All new and very scared

Posts.Content: Oh Kipper You have every right to feel the way you do now, with all that has gone on. Pulling yourself together......oh my .......you have every reason not to.......... but you will   !   You are obviously a fighter .....and that itself will help you get through this minefield. Allow yourself some time to let it all sink in and just be, dont be so hard on yourself. To lose a parent at the same time................cant be comprehended....I missed my Mum and Dad so much during my treatment....and I am 58 and they have been gone for 6 and 10 years. Yes the first chemo is part of it, but at least that means you have started to get rid of the unwanted guest (cancer). All of the other things you have and are going through will have a bearing on how you feel.....but do you know what....I can feel you will get there. What is your Breast Care nurse like ? Can you talk to her ? She might know if there is a group locally you can join, people going through the "c" thing. I am in Kent and have found a couple of ladies I can talk to.   Maybe there is someone here on Macland in your neck of the woods. If not us virtual friends are here....and sometimes just putting it in writing helps.   x
